description.paragraph1: Automatarium is a student-built platform for automata and formal language theory.
description.paragraph2: Work easily with a simple and intuitive design built for ease of use and accessibility.
description.paragraph3: It's free to use, and when you're done, share your project with the world with a link.
description.paragraph4: First time here? Check out our tutorials!

description.heading: Automatarium is open-source and free
description.paragraph1: Licensed under MIT, and hosted by RMIT University for everyone to use

description.heading: Fully-featured testing lab
description.paragraph1: Automatarium provides a simple but powerful testing lab. Step through inputs and see a live trace of what is happening. Try changing the input in the example and see what happens.
description.paragraph2: There is also a multi-run feature, run many tests at once and see which succeed and fail.

description.heading: Explore your automata
description.paragraph1: Automatarium provides tools to inspect your automaton and learn about how it reacts to different inputs.

description.heading: Share with colleagues
description.paragraph1: Easily share your projects with your peers via a link that lets anyone make a copy of your project and continue working.

description.heading: What are you waiting for?
description.paragraph1: Start building and testing your automata now!
